ground_truth: Two safety guys stand by as Carl dives off and free-falls hundreds of feet towards a river, then gets whipped back up by the heavy-duty elastic. Waving his arms, Carl swings back and forth beneath the giant, curved bridge supports and takes out his phone. Meanwhile, Wes is on a golf course and hands his phone to a caddy. At Norm's, there's a Sparta-themed party where Norm wears a red cape, holds a shield and spear, and later sits weeping with Carl beside him, looking anxious with his hand on Norm's shoulder. Norm wears a false beard and mustache, which starts slipping, and Carl sticks it back in place before looking down humbly. At home, Carl checks his answer phone. At the Bigfoot Lodge, the sign shows an ominous figure in a forest, and Carl stands outside the entrance looking pensive. Peter and Lucy walk up, and Carl leads them inside where he and Peter dance. Janet offers a piece of cake to Lee, and Faranoush looks again. Norm leans against the bar, looking morose, and Carl taps him on his left shoulder and leans round to his right, at which Norm bows. Norm dances around with his hand on Soo-Mi's shoulder as they walk off, and Lucy is with a group of friends. Carl catches her eye, smiles, and waves. Lucy points around the room and gives Carl a big thumbs-up, and they share a fond smile. Sitting alone at a table, Carl makes a phone call while Allison is at an exhibition of her photos, opens and then closes her phone as a woman looks at a photo of Carl sprawled on the ground. Allison smiles tightly, and the woman raises her eyebrows. Peter sits next to Carl and smiles. Meanwhile, Rooney stands at the bar alone, and Tillie walks up and smiles at him broadly, while he looks at her warily and then has a drink, knocks back a shot, and ushers her out of the bar, looking back cautiously as he goes. Carl arrives home, she kisses him, and he responds, kisses her for a moment, then pulls away sharply, looking pained. Carl gets into an elevator, presses a button, the doors close, and as the elevator descends, the light flickers. Carl looks up, the elevator stalls, and the doors open to reveal it's stuck below the level of the floor. Carl clambers out, walks off along the hall looking around cautiously, and as he walks across the forecourt, a black cat runs past behind him. Carl stumbles onto a car bonnet and sees a guy hooking his car up to a tow truck, realizing the guy is himself. Carl runs from his hallucination as Terrence drives away from a hotel with Carl popping up in the back of the car, and Terrence hits the gas.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description:
Certainly! Here is the transformed text with synonyms:

Two protection men stand nearby as Carl plunges off and plummets hundreds of feet towards a river, then gets snapped back up by the heavy-duty elastic. Gesturing his arms, Carl swings back and forth beneath the gigantic, arched bridge supports and takes out his phone. Meanwhile, Wes is on a golf course and hands his phone to a caddy. At Norm's, there's a Sparta-themed celebration where Norm wears a red cloak, holds a shield and spear, and later sits sobbing with Carl beside him, looking worried with his hand on Norm's shoulder. Norm wears a fake beard and mustache, which starts slipping, and Carl sticks it back in place before looking down modestly. At home, Carl checks his answering machine. At the Bigfoot Lodge, the sign shows a foreboding figure in a forest, and Carl stands outside the entrance looking thoughtful. Peter and Lucy walk up, and Carl leads them inside where he and Peter dance. Janet offers a piece of cake to Lee, and Faranoush looks again. Norm leans against the bar, looking gloomy, and Carl taps him on his left shoulder and leans around to his right, at which Norm nods. Norm dances around with his hand on Soo-Mi's shoulder as they walk off, and Lucy is with a group of companions. Carl catches her eye, smiles, and waves. Lucy points around the room and gives Carl a big thumbs-up, and they share a fond smile. Sitting alone at a table, Carl makes a phone call while Allison is at an exhibition of her photographs, opens and then closes her phone as a woman looks at a photograph of Carl sprawled on the ground. Allison smiles tightly, and the woman raises her eyebrows. Peter sits next to Carl and smiles. Meanwhile, Rooney stands at the bar alone, and Tillie walks up and smiles at him broadly, while he looks at her cautiously and then has a drink, tosses back a shot, and guides her out of the bar, looking back warily as he goes. Carl arrives home, she kisses him, and he responds, kisses her for a moment, then pulls away sharply, looking distressed. Carl gets into an elevator, presses a button, the doors close, and as the elevator descends, the light flickers. Carl looks up, the elevator stalls, and the doors open to reveal it's stuck below the level of the floor. Carl climbs out, walks off along the hall looking around cautiously, and as he walks across the forecourt, a black feline runs past behind him. Carl stumbles onto a car hood and sees a guy hooking his car up to a tow truck, realizing the guy is himself. Carl runs from his hallucination as Terrence drives away from a hotel with Carl popping up in the back of the car, and Terrence hits the accelerator.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Two safety officers watch as Carl dives, free-falling hundreds of feet toward a river before the elastic snaps him back up. Waving, Carl swings beneath bridge supports and takes out his phone. Wes, meanwhile, hands his phone to a caddy on a golf course. At Norm's Sparta-themed party, Norm wears a red cape, shield, and spear, later sitting with Carl, concerned. Norm's false beard slips, and Carl fixes it before humbly looking down. At home, Carl checks his voicemail. At Bigfoot Lodge, the sign shows an ominous figure, and Carl stands outside, pensive. Peter and Lucy approach, and Carl leads them inside to dance with Peter. Janet offers Lee cake, and Faranoush glances again. Norm leans against the bar, morose, and Carl taps his shoulder, prompting Norm to bow. Norm dances with Soo-Mi as they depart, while Lucy, with friends, shares a fond smile with Carl. Sitting alone, Carl calls Allison at her photo exhibition; a woman views a photo of Carl on the ground. Allison smiles tightly as the woman raises her eyebrows. Peter joins Carl, smiling. Meanwhile, Rooney is at the bar alone until Tillie approaches; he looks wary, drinks a shot, and leaves with her, checking back cautiously. Carl arrives home, kisses her, then pulls away, pained. In an elevator, Carl presses a button, doors close, then the light flickers. The elevator stalls, doors open below floor level, and Carl exits, looking around cautiously. Crossing the forecourt, a black cat passes behind him. Carl stumbles onto a car bonnet, seeing a guy hooking his car to a tow truck—it’s himself. Carl runs from this vision as Terrence drives away with Carl appearing in the back seat, and Terrence speeds off.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Two safety guys watch as Carl free-falls toward a river and is pulled back by elastic. Carl swings under bridge supports and takes out his phone. Wes, on a golf course, gives his phone to a caddy. At Norm's Sparta-themed party, Norm wears a red cape, shield, and spear, sits weeping while Carl adjusts his fake beard. At home, Carl checks messages. Outside the Bigfoot Lodge, Carl looks pensive. Peter and Lucy arrive; Carl leads them inside and dances with Peter. Janet offers cake to Lee, while Norm dances with Soo-Mi. Lucy and Carl exchange smiles. Carl makes a call at a table as Allison is at a photo exhibition. A woman notices Carl's photo; Allison smiles tightly. Rooney stands alone at the bar, Tillie approaches, and Rooney ushers her out cautiously. Carl arrives home, kisses Tillie, but pulls away pained. In an elevator, Carl is stuck as lights flicker, clambers out and walks, seeing a black cat. He hallucinates a tow truck taking his car with himself driving, then runs as Terrence speeds away with Carl in the backseat.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Standing by attentively, two safety personnel are present as Carl, with great determination, dives off the edge, entering a thrilling free-fall that spans hundreds of feet downwards towards a rapidly approaching river. The heavy-duty elastic bungee cord then snaps him back upwards, offering a rush of adrenaline. As he waves his arms energetically, Carl swings back and forth beneath the towering, curved supports of the giant bridge, managing to take out his phone with practiced ease. Meanwhile, over at a peaceful golf course, Wes decides to hand his phone over to the nearby caddy. At Norm's place, an exciting Sparta-themed party is in full swing, with Norm himself embracing the theme by donning a vibrant red cape, holding a traditional shield and spear. Eventually, he finds himself sitting down, tears brimming in his eyes, with Carl beside him, looking concerned as he places a reassuring hand on Norm’s shoulder. During the festivities, Norm sports a false beard and mustache, which begin to slip, prompting Carl to gently adjust it back into place, afterward directing his gaze downward with a touch of humility. 

Later on, at home, Carl takes a moment to check his answering machine. Meanwhile, at the Bigfoot Lodge, a sign ominously depicts a shadowy figure amidst a forest setting, with Carl standing pensively just outside the entrance. As Peter and Lucy approach, Carl welcomes them inside, where an impromptu dance session ensues between him and Peter. Amidst this lively scene, Janet offers a delectable piece of cake to Lee, while Faranoush looks around once more. At the bar, Norm leans somberly, appearing quite morose until Carl taps him gently on the left shoulder, playfully leaning around to the right, prompting Norm to bow ceremoniously. Norm then dances exuberantly with his hand resting on Soo-Mi's shoulder as they make their exit, while Lucy enjoys the company of a group of friends. Carl catches Lucy's eye from across the room, smiling warmly and waving. In response, Lucy gestures around the room and gives Carl an enthusiastic thumbs-up, which they exchange with fond smiles.

Sitting alone at a table, Carl dials a number on his phone. Meanwhile, at Allison's photography exhibition, she opens and closes her phone quickly while a woman nearby examines a photograph of Carl sprawled on the ground. Allison offers a tight-lipped smile, while the woman merely raises her eyebrows in response. Peter takes a seat next to Carl, sharing a smile. Rooney stands alone at the bar, only to be approached by Tillie, who offers him a broad, inviting smile. He regards her cautiously, takes a drink, downs a shot, and ushers her out of the bar, casting a wary glance back over his shoulder as he departs.

When Carl returns home, there’s a tender moment when she greets him with a kiss, to which he responds with affection, but he pulls away abruptly, a look of distress crossing his face. As Carl enters an elevator, he presses a button and watches the doors slide shut. During the descent, the elevator lights flicker ominously, causing Carl to look up just as the elevator stalls, the doors opening to reveal it is stuck below the floor level. He carefully climbs out and walks along the hallway, surveying his surroundings cautiously. As he crosses the forecourt, a black cat dashes by behind him, unnoticed. Carl accidentally stumbles onto a car bonnet, catching sight of a man hooking his car to a tow truck and realizing with shock that the man is himself. In a frightful response to this hallucination, Carl takes off running as Terrence drives away from a hotel. Miraculously, Carl appears in the backseat of the car, prompting Terrence to slam on the gas.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Standing by with vigilant attention, two safety personnel are present as Carl, filled with unwavering determination, bravely dives off the edge. He enters a thrilling free-fall that spans an impressive distance of hundreds of feet, plummeting downwards towards the rapidly approaching river below. The heavy-duty elastic bungee cord then snaps him back upwards, providing an exhilarating rush of adrenaline. Waving his arms energetically in the air, Carl swings back and forth beneath the towering, curved supports of the giant bridge. He skillfully manages to take out his phone with practiced ease. Meanwhile, over at a serene and peaceful golf course, Wes decides to hand his phone over to the nearby caddy for safekeeping. At Norm's place, an exciting and lively Sparta-themed party is in full swing, with Norm himself fully embracing the ancient theme by donning a vibrant red cape and holding a traditional shield and spear. Eventually, he finds himself sitting down, tears brimming in his eyes, with Carl seated beside him, looking concerned and placing a reassuring hand on Norm’s shoulder. During the festivities, Norm wears a false beard and mustache, which begin to slip, prompting Carl to gently adjust them back into place. Afterward, Carl directs his gaze downward with a touch of humility.

Later on, when Carl is at home, he takes a moment to check his answering machine, listening for any new messages. Meanwhile, at the Bigfoot Lodge, a sign ominously depicts a shadowy figure amidst a dense forest setting. Carl stands pensively just outside the entrance, deep in thought. As Peter and Lucy approach, Carl warmly welcomes them inside, where an impromptu dance session ensues between him and Peter. Amidst this lively and cheerful scene, Janet offers a delectable piece of cake to Lee, while Faranoush looks around the room once more, taking in the atmosphere. At the bar, Norm leans somberly, appearing quite morose until Carl taps him gently on the left shoulder, playfully leaning around to the right, which prompts Norm to bow in a ceremonious manner. Norm then dances exuberantly, with his hand resting on Soo-Mi's shoulder as they make their exit together, while Lucy enjoys the company of a group of friends. Carl catches Lucy's eye from across the room, smiling warmly and waving. In response, Lucy gestures around the room and gives Carl an enthusiastic thumbs-up, which they exchange with fond smiles.

Sitting alone at a table, Carl dials a number on his phone, contemplating his next move. Meanwhile, at Allison's photography exhibition, she opens and closes her phone quickly, conveying urgency, while a woman nearby examines a photograph of Carl sprawled on the ground. Allison offers a tight-lipped smile, while the woman merely raises her eyebrows in response. Peter takes a seat next to Carl, sharing a moment of understanding with a smile. Rooney stands alone at the bar, only to be approached by Tillie, who offers him a broad, inviting smile. He regards her cautiously, takes a swig of his drink, downs a shot, and then ushers her out of the bar, casting a wary glance back over his shoulder as they leave the area.

When Carl returns home, there’s a tender moment as she greets him warmly with a kiss, to which he responds with affection. However, he pulls away abruptly, a look of distress crossing his face. Entering an elevator, Carl presses a button and watches as the doors slide shut. During the descent, the elevator lights flicker ominously, causing Carl to look up just as the elevator stalls, the doors opening to reveal it is stuck below the floor level. He carefully climbs out and walks cautiously along the hallway, surveying his surroundings with care. As he crosses the forecourt, a black cat dashes by behind him, going unnoticed. Carl accidentally stumbles onto a car bonnet, catching sight of a man hooking his car to a tow truck, realizing with shock that the man is, in fact, himself. In a frightful response to this unsettling hallucination, Carl takes off running as Terrence drives away from a nearby hotel. Miraculously, Carl appears in the backseat of the car, prompting Terrence to slam on the gas and speed away.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Two safety guys stand patiently by, ensuring everything is secure, as Carl gathers his courage and forcefully dives off, entering a thrilling free-fall that sends him hurtling hundreds of feet toward the river below. In a sudden jolt, the heavy-duty elastic bungee cord attached to him stretches to its limit and then rebounds, whipping Carl back up toward the sky. He, momentarily suspended, waves his arms to regain balance and control as he begins to swing back and forth beneath the massive, elegantly curved bridge supports overhead. Amid this exhilarating moment, Carl manages to reach into his pocket, pull out his phone, and perhaps capture or share this incredible experience. In a completely different setting, Wes is situated on a serene golf course, and, deciding to temporarily disconnect, he hands his phone over to a waiting caddy, entrusting it to their care. Meanwhile, at Norm's lively Sparta-themed party, Norm embraces the theme, draping himself in a striking red cape, and brandishing a shield and spear, embodying the fierce spirit of a Spartan warrior. Later, the mood shifts as Norm finds himself sitting with tears in his eyes, with Carl sitting close beside him. Carl looks at Norm with a mix of concern and empathy, resting his hand gently on Norm's shoulder in a comforting gesture. Norm, still maintaining his thematic attire, is wearing a false beard and mustache, both of which begin to slip out of place. Observing this, Carl quickly reaches over to readjust and secure the faux facial hair, his demeanor shifting to one of humility as he then directs his gaze downwards. Returning to his own home, Carl takes a moment to check his answering machine, listening for any messages he might have missed. Over at the Bigfoot Lodge, an imposing sign depicting an ominous figure standing amidst a dense forest creates an air of mystery, and Carl stands outside the entrance, deep in thought as he contemplates going inside. Just then, Peter and Lucy arrive and join Carl, who leads them through the entrance into the lively atmosphere within, where Carl and Peter soon find themselves caught up in the spirit of celebration, dancing energetically. Meanwhile, Janet extends a slice of cake to Lee, offering a small gesture of hospitality, as Faranoush glances back again, possibly intrigued by the interaction. Norm leans against the bar, his demeanor somber and distant, when Carl taps him lightly on his left shoulder, then quickly leans around to his right side, catching Norm off guard and making him bow in reaction. A moment later, Norm is seen dancing around, one hand resting on Soo-Mi's shoulder for support as they walk off together, while Lucy mingles with a group of her friends nearby. Carl, catching her eye, flashes a warm, friendly smile and waves in her direction. Lucy, acknowledging Carl, energetically points around the room, signaling something of interest, and offers Carl an enthusiastic thumbs-up, to which he responds with a fond smile, sharing a moment of mutual understanding and approval. Later, Carl sits alone at a table, absorbed in thought as he makes a phone call, reaching out to connect with someone at that moment. At an art exhibition where Allison is displaying her photographs, she flips open her phone, checks something quickly, and then closes it, as a nearby woman studies an image of Carl sprawled out on the ground. Allison maintains a tight smile, subtly masking her true feelings, while the woman raises her eyebrows, perhaps in surprise or amusement at the photo. Then, Peter sits down next to Carl, a pleasant smile gracing his face, offering camaraderie and silent support. Meanwhile, Rooney stands alone at the bar, lost in contemplation until Tillie approaches and greets him with a wide, friendly smile. Rooney, taken by surprise, regards her warily but accepts her presence, takes a moment to down a drink, swiftly knocks back a shot for courage, then motions for her to follow as he cautiously leads her out of the bar, glancing back to ensure all is well. Carl eventually arrives back home, where he is greeted with a kiss; he responds warmly, engaging in the kiss for a brief moment before abruptly pulling away, a flash of pain crossing his features, revealing an inner turmoil. Entering an elevator, Carl presses a button to begin his descent, the elevator doors closing with a mechanical hum. As the elevator travels downwards, the lights flicker ominously, catching Carl's attention as he instinctively glances upwards. Suddenly, the elevator shudders to a halt, its doors sliding open to reveal that it is stranded just shy of the intended floor level. With caution, Carl maneuvers his way out of the elevator, stepping up and walking along the hall with an air of vigilance. Crossing the forecourt, a black cat darts past him, a shadow slipping through the night. Startled, Carl stumbles against the bonnet of a car, where he witnesses, with growing dread, a surreal vision of a man hooking his car to a tow truck—the man, unmistakably, is a version of himself. Panicked and confused by this hallucination, Carl bolts from the scene, only to find himself later with Terrence, who drives swiftly away from a hotel. Carl, having somehow emerged in the back of the car, prompts Terrence to hit the gas, speeding them away from whatever unspoken threat looms behind.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Carl, supervised by safety personnel, performs a thrilling bungee jump, experiencing a rapid descent toward a river before being pulled back by the elastic cord. As he swings under the bridge, he retrieves his phone. Meanwhile, on a golf course, Wes entrusts his phone to a caddy. During a Sparta-themed party at Norm's place, Norm dons a costume with a red cape, shield, and spear, later appearing distressed as Carl consoles him. Carl readjusts Norm's slipping fake beard and shows humility. At home, Carl checks his voicemail. Outside the Bigfoot Lodge, Carl reflects thoughtfully before meeting Peter and Lucy, who he leads inside to join a dance. Janet offers Lee a piece of cake, while Faranoush takes notice again. Norm, feeling down at the bar, gets a playful nudge from Carl, prompting Norm to dance with Soo-Mi and move on, as Lucy acknowledges Carl with a thumbs-up. Alone at a table, Carl makes a call as Allison attends a photo exhibition featuring an image of Carl, eliciting mixed reactions. Peter joins Carl with a smile, while Rooney, at the bar, is approached by Tillie, who, despite his hesitance, exits with him after a drink. Returning home, Carl shares a brief, tense kiss with someone before pulling away. In an elevator, Carl experiences a flickering light and a stall, leading him to exit cautiously when it stops below the floor level. He then walks through a hall and forecourt, inadvertently startling a black cat, before witnessing a surreal encounter where he sees himself hooking a car to a tow truck. Panicked, Carl flees from this vision, culminating in him appearing in Terrence’s car as Terrence accelerates away from a hotel.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Two safety guys, trained in high-risk activities like bungee jumping, stand by as Carl dives off and free-falls hundreds of feet towards a river, often used for adrenaline sports, then gets whipped back up by the heavy-duty elastic designed to withstand extreme forces. Waving his arms, Carl swings back and forth beneath the giant, curved bridge supports of the New River Gorge Bridge, known for its iconic structure, and takes out his phone. Meanwhile, Wes is on a golf course, a popular 18-hole course famous for its challenging greens, and hands his phone to a caddy who knows the course like the back of his hand. At Norm's, a bar which often hosts themed parties, there's a Sparta-themed party where Norm, channeling his inner Spartan warrior, wears a red cape, holds a shield and spear reminiscent of the legendary Battle of Thermopylae, and later sits weeping with Carl beside him, looking anxious with his hand on Norm's shoulder. Norm wears a false beard and mustache, which starts slipping comically, and Carl sticks it back in place before looking down humbly. At home, Carl checks his answer phone, an older model that still uses tapes. At the Bigfoot Lodge, a rustic bar known for its quirky décor, the sign shows an ominous figure in a forest, an homage to the legendary creature, and Carl stands outside the entrance looking pensive. Peter and Lucy walk up, and Carl leads them inside where he and Peter dance to a lively folk tune. Janet offers a piece of cake to Lee, a regular at the lodge, and Faranoush looks again, intrigued by the scene. Norm leans against the bar, looking morose as if pondering a deep thought, and Carl taps him on his left shoulder and leans round to his right, at which Norm bows in mock medieval courtesy. Norm dances around with his hand on Soo-Mi's shoulder as they walk off, and Lucy is with a group of friends celebrating her promotion. Carl catches her eye, smiles, and waves, a gesture of continued friendship. Lucy points around the room, indicating shared memories, and gives Carl a big thumbs-up, and they share a fond smile. Sitting alone at a table, Carl makes a phone call while Allison is at an exhibition of her photos, hosted by a renowned local gallery, opens and then closes her phone as a woman looks at a photo of Carl sprawled on the ground during a memorable road trip. Allison smiles tightly, aware of the emotional memories, and the woman raises her eyebrows in curiosity. Peter sits next to Carl and smiles, trying to lift his spirits. Meanwhile, Rooney stands at the bar alone, contemplating life, and Tillie walks up and smiles at him broadly, while he looks at her warily and then has a drink, knocks back a shot of whiskey, and ushers her out of the bar, looking back cautiously as he goes. Carl arrives home, greeted by the comforting scent of a familiar meal, she kisses him, and he responds, kisses her for a moment, then pulls away sharply, looking pained by a troubling memory. Carl gets into an elevator, presses a button for his floor, the doors close, and as the elevator descends, the light flickers ominously. Carl looks up, the elevator stalls, an unnerving occurrence in the old building, and the doors open to reveal it's stuck below the level of the floor. Carl clambers out carefully, walks off along the hall looking around cautiously as though expecting something amiss, and as he walks across the forecourt of the apartment complex, a black cat runs past behind him, an occurrence often seen as bad luck. Carl stumbles onto a car bonnet and sees a guy hooking his car up to a tow truck, realizing the guy is himself in a surreal reflection of his stress. Carl runs from his hallucination as Terrence, his old friend from college, drives away from a hotel with Carl popping up in the back of the car, and Terrence hits the gas, accelerating towards an uncertain destination.

Carl clambers out walks off along the hall looking around cautiously and as he walks across the forecourt a black cat runs past behind him. Carl stumbles onto a car bonnet and sees a guy hooking his car up to a tow truck realizing the guy is himself. Carl runs from his hallucination as Terrence drives away from a hotel with Carl popping up in the back of the car and Terrence hits the gas.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Two safety guys stand by as Carl dives off and freefalls hundreds of feet towards a river then gets whipped back up by the heavyduty elastic. Waving his arms Carl swings back and forth beneath the giant curved bridge supports and takes out his phone. Meanwhile Wes is on a golf course and hands his phone to a caddy. At Norm's there is a Spartathemed party where Norm wears a red cape holds a shield and spear and later sits weeping with Carl beside him looking anxious with his hand on Norm's shoulder. Norm wears a false beard and mustache which starts slipping and Carl sticks it back in place before looking down humbly. At home Carl checks his answer phone. At the Bigfoot Lodge the sign shows an ominous figure in a forest and Carl stands outside the entrance looking pensive. Peter and Lucy walk up and Carl leads them inside where he and Peter dance. Janet offers a piece of cake to Lee and Faranoush looks again. Norm leans against the bar looking morose and Carl taps him on his left shoulder and leans round to his right at which Norm bows. Norm dances around with his hand on SooMi's shoulder as they walk off and Lucy is with a group of friends. Carl catches her eye smiles and waves. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Lucy points around the room and gives Carl a big thumbsup and they share a fond smile. Sitting alone at a table Carl makes a phone call while Allison is at an exhibition of her photos opens and then closes her phone as a woman looks at a photo of Carl sprawled on the ground. Allison smiles tightly and the woman raises her eyebrows. Peter sits next to Carl and smiles. Meanwhile Rooney stands at the bar alone and Tillie walks up and smiles at him broadly while he looks at her warily and then has a drink knocks back a shot and ushers her out of the bar looking back cautiously. as he goes. Carl arrives home she kisses him and he responds kisses her for a moment then pulls away sharply looking pained. Carl gets into an elevator presses a button the doors close and as the elevator descends the light flickers. Carl looks up the elevator stalls and the doors open to reveal it is stuck below the level of the floor. Carl clambers out walks off along the hall looking around cautiously and as he walks across the forecourt a black cat runs past behind him. Carl stumbles onto a car bonnet and sees a guy hooking his car up to a tow truck realizing the guy is himself. Carl runs from his hallucination as Terrence drives away from a hotel with Carl popping up in the back of the car and Terrence hits the gas.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Two bakery mice waddle by as Jim hops on and hovers dozens of inches towards a canyon, then gets flung back up by the flimsy helium balloon. Flapping his wings, Jim drifts side to side beneath the tiny, flat roof beams and pulls out his wrench. Meanwhile, Dane is on a soccer field and tosses his wrench to a gardener. At Ralph's, there's a disco-themed concert where Ralph wears a blue jacket, waves a wand and trumpet, and later lies giggling with Jim beside him, looking thrilled with his foot on Ralph's elbow. Ralph wears a rubber hat and glasses, which starts tumbling, and Jim nudges it back in place before gazing up shyly. At work, Jim checks his calendar. At the Unicorn Barn, the poster displays a cheerful puppy in a meadow, and Jim sits inside the exit looking delighted. Molly and Ralph skip up, and Jim guides them outside where he and Molly juggle. Sam hands a slice of cheese to Joe, and Claudia blinks again. Ralph leans against the wall, looking ecstatic, and Jim pats him on his right elbow and sneaks round to his left, at which Ralph twirls. Ralph juggles around with his foot on Beth's elbow as they dash off, and Molly is with a band of colleagues. Jim catches her glance, grins, and claps. Molly gestures around the garden and gives Jim a small head nod, and they share a warm grin. Standing alone in a cabin, Jim writes a letter while Sophia is at a showcase of her paintings, unfolds and then folds her letter as a gentleman glances at a drawing of Jim sitting on a chair. Sophia frowns slightly, and the gentleman shrugs his shoulders. Molly sits near Jim and frowns. Meanwhile, Danny waits at the table alone, and Tessa approaches and frowns at him broadly, while he stares at her eagerly and then eats a snack, sips a soda, and guides her out of the table, staring forward blissfully as he stays. Jim leaves work, she embraces him, and he laughs, embraces her for a while, then steps back quickly, looking delighted. Jim climbs onto an escalator, presses a switch, the steps shift, and as the escalator ascends, the ceiling glows. Jim peers down, the escalator jerks, and the steps shift to reveal it's elevated above the level of the ceiling. Jim slides down, skips off along the park glancing around excitedly, and as he skips over the carousel, a white rabbit hops past beside him. Jim tiptoes onto a tree trunk and notices a bird connecting its nest to a kite, realizing the bird is himself. Jim skips from his daydream as Fiona pedals away from a store with Jim waving in the front of the bike, and Fiona hits the brakes.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Carl takes a daring dive off a bridge, supported by safety staff, experiencing an exhilarating fall and capturing the moment on his phone. Simultaneously, Wes is golfing, while Norm hosts a Sparta-themed party, dressed in a red cape but ends up emotional, with Carl comforting him. At the Bigfoot Lodge, Carl contemplates outside before joining Peter and Lucy inside, where he shares smiles with Lucy. Carl makes a call at a table as Allison, at her photo exhibit, acknowledges a photo of Carl. Rooney, at the bar, interacts cautiously with Tillie before leaving. Returning home, Carl kisses someone but withdraws abruptly, appearing distressed. In an elevator, Carl experiences a flicker and gets stuck, forcing him to climb out. As he walks through the hall, a cat dashes by, and he witnesses a vision of himself hooking his car to a tow truck, prompting him to flee. Terrence then drives away, with Carl unexpectedly appearing in his car.
